com.soa.message.handler
Class DynamicHandlerChainFactory

java.lang.Object
  com.soa.message.handler.DynamicHandlerChainFactory
All Implemented Interfaces:
HandlerFactory
public class DynamicHandlerChainFactory
extends java.lang.Object
implements HandlerFactory

HandlerFactory implementation that will create a ChainHandler of MessageHandlers. It will retain a relationship to the created ChainHandler and if a HandlerFactory is added or removed, the ChainHandler will be altered so that the corresponding MessageHandlers are are also added or removed. Ordering of the handlers will match the ordering of the factories.

Method Detail

setHandleOutInReverse

public void setHandleOutInReverse(boolean handleInReverse)
Configures whether the handlers in the chain should be called in reverse for out/fault messages.

Parameters:
handleInReverse - True if handlers should be called in reverse, false if not. Default is true.

setCloseInReverse

public void setCloseInReverse(boolean closeInReverse)
Configures whether the handlers in the chain should be closed in reverse order.

Parameters:
closeInReverse - True if handlers should be closed in reverse order, false if not. Default is true.

create

public MessageHandler create(HandlerContext context,
                             HandlerRole role)
                      throws GException
Creates a ChainHandler that implements a chain of handlers. The ChainHandler will be updated based on changes to the list of handler factories. This factory will retain a reference to the chain handler. Use the clear() method to break the association at which time the handler will no longer be updated.

Specified by:
create in interface HandlerFactory
Parameters:
context - HandlerContext describing the scope of the handler chain.
role - HandlerRole of the created handler.
Returns:
ChainHandler with nested handlers, null if no factories have been configured.
Throws:
GException - Thrown if an error was encountered trying to create the handler.

clear

public void clear()
Breaks the association between this factory and the MessageHandler created by the factory. This will cause the handler to no longer be updated.
